text: I am waiting with baited breath for the response from the Australian government to Italy blocking export of  150K AZ vaccines that were bound for Australia.

text: Big oof. Punishment for AZ pissing off EU?

elements.text: Big oof. Punishment for AZ pissing off EU?

text: Yeah AZ’s last delivery to Italy was 10-15% light (though they say they are inline with their contract and will deliver the full by the end of the quarter or something)

text: The whole Astrazeneca thing has been pretty frustrating to watch

text: I'm pretty sure AZ deliveries to EU were halved compared to AZs estimates. What pisses EU off is that EU paid 336 million € up front to ensure fast production, and that AZ then doesn't deliver. Most infuriatingly, the british/swedish company DOES deliver all doses it promised to the UK

What pisses EU off is that EU paid 336 million € up front to ensure fast production, and that AZ then doesn't deliver. Most infuriatingly, the british/swedish company DOES deliver all doses it promised to the UK

text: As far as I can read online, they are not in breach of any contract by doing that, but it's pretty obviously a dick move

elements.text: As far as I can read online, they are not in breach of any contract by doing that, but it's pretty obviously a dick move

text: Yeah, the whole astrazeneca vaccine story is pretty bad. It was one first vaccines to be ready, with high expectations, cooled down by a couple of interruptions in testing due to volunteers reporting side effects (but the company later said they were unrelated). Then the reported efficacy was quite lower than the competition, especially in elderly people, this, together with lots of mishaps by the company (efficacy may be higher with reduced dose, discovered by mistake, but in a very limited sample of volunteers) brought many countries to look elsewhere. Then the company announced it couldn't deliver a large fraction of vaccines to Europe, while for other countries don't have the same issues (even though vaccines are produced in the same facilities). European countries are extremely pissed off, but are also now realising, looking at the UK, that the vaccine may be effective enough so they're scrambling to get it, but at the same time they have already doses of the astrazeneca vaccine that they aren't using (I was reading a few days ago that France had a large fraction of the stockpile still there). It's just a huge mess, and the company behaviour, in several stages, didn't help much

elements.text: Yeah, the whole astrazeneca vaccine story is pretty bad. Then the reported efficacy was quite lower than the competition, especially in elderly people, this, together with lots of mishaps by the company (efficacy may be higher with reduced dose, discovered by mistake, but in a very limited sample of volunteers) brought many countries to look elsewhere. Then the company announced it couldn't deliver a large fraction of vaccines to Europe, while for other countries don't have the same issues (even though vaccines are produced in the same facilities). European countries are extremely pissed off, but are also now realising, looking at the UK, that the vaccine may be effective enough so they're scrambling to get it, but at the same time they have already doses of the astrazeneca vaccine that they aren't using (I was reading a few days ago that France had a large fraction of the stockpile still there). It's just a huge mess, and the company behaviour, in several stages, didn't help much

text: Also, EU landed it's vaccine deals too late. At least in Denmark, that made EU pretty unpopular, I would guess elsewhere in EU, too. So now the commission and Ursula von der Leyen has to appear tough to deflect criticism.

elements.text: Also, EU landed it's vaccine deals too late. At least in Denmark, that made EU pretty unpopular, I would guess elsewhere in EU, too. So now the commission and Ursula von der Leyen has to appear tough to deflect criticism.

text: There have been definitely lots of errors on both sides, sad that it's for something this important at the moment

elements.text: There have been definitely lots of errors on both sides, sad that it's for something this important at the moment

text: Also, a few days ago there was a row about Angela Merkel refusing to take the astrazeneca vaccine because she wasn't in the age to take, just before the German drugs agency lifted age restrictions. It's just a bad show to watch
